info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 29 at 5:58PM EDT until July 29 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Transylvania County in western North Carolina... Northwestern Henderson County in western North Carolina... Southeastern Haywood County in western North Carolina... Southwestern Buncombe County in western North Carolina... * Until 645 PM EDT. * At 557 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles east of Waynesville, or 5 miles south of Canton, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Canton, Bent Creek, Clyde, Graveyard Fields, Looking Glass, Mount Pisgah, Black Balsam Area, Candler, Cruso, and the Blue Ridge Parkway between Mount Pisgah and The NC Arboretum. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Brief damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines over small areas. A brief period of large hail is also possible. Seek shelter inside an interior room. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
